p: Concerning the rhizome, it is evident its richness in terpenoid derivatives ( Figure 2), from which cycloartane, hopanoid, and phytosterol derivatives can be highlighted and being the major compounds hop-16-ene (166.45 ± 0.53 mg/g dry rhizome), β-sitosterol (50.76 ± 0.11 mg/g dry rhizome), diploptene (48.01 ± 0.13 mg/g dry rhizome), cycloeucalenone (26.75 ± 0.02 mg/g dry rhizome), campesterol (25.64 ± 0.12 mg/g dry rhizome), and 31-norcyclolaudenone (21.05 ± 0.06 mg/g dry rhizome) ( Table 3 and Figure 3).
